page.title: 18TRANSPORT:WALLINGFORD BYPASS
page.content: Traffic in Wallingford is its greatest problem.In a recent survey on the bridge a total of 302 vehicles passed in 30 minutes.220 cars,47 vans,29 lorries and 6 busses.Juggernauts driving along the narrow high street are a source of danger,noise,damage and pollution.Wallingford has long campaigned for a bypass and it appears that this will happen in the 1990s. The proposed bypass includes a new bridge over the Thames as well as road construction.The bridge would be just south of Carmel College.A bypass would obviously be of great benefet to Wallingford but there are objections from loacal tradespeople ,conservationists and residents who live near the route.
